BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Farmer
BackstoryDef.title: farmer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] lived a simple life, tending to [PAWN_possessive] crops and removing weeds from dawn to dusk. The soil was familiar beneath [PAWN_possessive] hands, steady and honest work. There was pride in knowing that [PAWN_pronoun] helped feed the imperial navy, that every harvest kept the soldiers strong and the fleet running.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Recruit
BackstoryDef.title: imperial recruit
BackstoryDef.description: Freshly graduated from boot camp, [PAWN_nameDef] stepped out of the deployment shuttle with barely contained enthusiasm. People said [PAWN_pronoun]'d see real action around the Rimworlds, and [PAWN_nameDef] was about to find out.
[PAWN_nameDef] crisply saluted [PAWN_possessive] new commander the moment [PAWN_pronoun] stepped off the shuttle. First impressions lasted long, and [PAWN_nameDef] wasn’t about to mess it up.

Orders in hand, [PAWN_nameDef] rehearsed the salute one last time and tried to steady a racing pulse. New squad, new officers, a clean slate—exactly what [PAWN_pronoun] had hoped for. If the empire needed enthusiasm, [PAWN_pronoun] had plenty; if it needed results, [PAWN_pronoun] would deliver them.

The shuttle doors opened on a new command, and [PAWN_nameDef] felt nerves spark under the armor. This was the posting [PAWN_pronoun] wanted—real duty, real stakes. [PAWN_pronoun] checked [PAWN_possessive] kit twice, squared [PAWN_possessive] shoulders, and stepped out ready to prove [PAWN_possessive] worth.

BackstoryDef.title: lucky recruit
BackstoryDef.description: Fresh from boot camp, [PAWN_nameDef] clutched [PAWN_possessive] lucky charm as the shuttle touched down. A new station, a new chain of command—[PAWN_pronoun] straightened [PAWN_possessive] uniform and braced for the first impression.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Trooper
BackstoryDef.title: naval trooper
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] served as a trooper in the imperial navy, eager to see action against the empire’s enemies. After a few dozen close calls on anti-pirate patrols, [PAWN_pronoun] began to hope for uneventful days instead.

Life in the imperial navy wasn’t glamorous. [PAWN_nameDef] spent hours polishing gear, running drills, and scrubbing decks—only to be thrown into firefights at a moment’s notice. The empire demanded readiness, and [PAWN_pronoun] delivered.

[PAWN_nameDef] thought life as a trooper would mean endless heroics, but reality was harsher: long marches, sudden ambushes, and the constant hum of orders. Still, [PAWN_pronoun] never complained—every mission was another step toward proving [PAWN_possessive] worth.

Most of [PAWN_nameDef]’s days in the imperial navy blurred into a cycle of drills, inspections, and patrols. But every so often, a mission turned deadly without warning. Those bursts of chaos reminded [PAWN_objective] why preparation mattered more than dreams of glory.

In the imperial navy, [PAWN_nameDef] learned that the hardest battles weren’t always fought against raiders. They were fought against fatigue, hunger, and the creeping thought that the next deployment might be the last. Even so, [PAWN_pronoun] never failed to suit up when the orders came.

As a trooper, [PAWN_nameDef] quickly learned that glory was rare, but danger was constant. A single mistake could cost a squad everything, so [PAWN_pronoun] drilled until every movement was second nature. The god of war favored perfection, and [PAWN_nameDef] intended to give nothing less.

Many troopers grumbled about long patrol routes, but [PAWN_nameDef] found purpose in them. Every quiet journey meant another world safe from raiders. Every captured pirate meant fewer innocents lost. It was a slow war, but one [PAWN_pronoun] believed was worth fighting.

The empire’s enemies lurked at the edges of settled space, and troopers were sent to flush them out. For [PAWN_nameDef], that meant sudden deployments, long nights without sleep, and the knowledge that the next firefight could be [PAWN_possessive] last. Still, [PAWN_pronoun] never faltered.

BackstoryDef.title: brash trooper
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a walking storm of curses, filling barracks and battlefields alike with [PAWN_possessive] foul mouth. Officers hated it, squads laughed at it—but when the shooting started, [PAWN_pronoun] fought like hell and always pulled through.

[PAWN_nameDef] fought with ruthless zeal, seeing pirates and traitors as vermin to be exterminated. Protecting citizens came easy—but tending wounds never interested [PAWN_objective]. Some whispered [PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed the killing a little too much.

[PAWN_nameDef] signed up to fight pirates and rebels, but spent more hours waiting than shooting. Between long guard shifts, [PAWN_pronoun] buried [PAWN_objective]self in novels, finding calm in stories while narrowly avoiding inspections.

[PAWN_nameDef] thought the navy would be all glory and battle. Instead, most days were long patrols with tense standoffs. [PAWN_pronoun] passed the downtime by sneaking rations of chocolate, a small comfort against the cold of deep space.

[PAWN_nameDef] stood out not for strength but for quick thinking. While others relied on muscle and drills, [PAWN_pronoun] solved problems on the fly—rewiring a hatch under fire, finding cover where none seemed to exist. Brains kept [PAWN_objective] alive where brawn might not.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_MPTrooper
BackstoryDef.title: military police
BackstoryDef.description: Not every threat to the empire came from pirates or raiders. Some came from within the ranks. [PAWN_nameDef] served as military police, rooting out smugglers, brawlers, and deserters before their actions could endanger the empire.

Discipline was a weapon, and [PAWN_nameDef] wielded it with precision. When troopers tested boundaries, [PAWN_pronoun] was there to set them straight. The empire trusted [PAWN_objective] to ensure its soldiers fought the enemy, not each other.

On patrol through the ship’s lower decks, [PAWN_nameDef] kept a watchful eye for contraband and misconduct. A sharp word or firm hand was often enough, but when it wasn’t, [PAWN_pronoun] made sure discipline was restored swiftly.

Keeping soldiers in line was no easy task. [PAWN_nameDef] spent countless hours breaking up brawls, confiscating illicit goods, and reminding troopers that the empire’s law didn’t stop at the barracks door. Order came first, no matter the cost.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_TrooperCook
BackstoryDef.title: culinary specialist
BackstoryDef.description: Life as a navy cook meant long hours in hot galleys, preparing meals for hundreds of hungry troopers. [PAWN_nameDef] learned quickly that good food kept morale higher than any speech, and [PAWN_pronoun] took pride in every tray served.

While others drilled with rifles, [PAWN_nameDef] drilled with knives and ladles. A steady hand in the galley meant steady minds in battle, and [PAWN_pronoun] was determined to keep the imperial navy sharp through [PAWN_possessive] cooking.

[PAWN_nameDef] always claimed the mess hall was as important as the armory. Hungry troopers grew reckless, but a hot meal after a deployment steadied nerves. The empire needed discipline, and [PAWN_pronoun] served it one plate at a time.

On long voyages, supplies ran thin and tempers grew short. [PAWN_nameDef] became skilled at stretching rations, turning scraps into hearty meals that kept the squad satisfied. It was quiet work, but [PAWN_pronoun] knew it kept the navy running.

The empire needed more than soldiers—it needed someone to feed them. [PAWN_nameDef] served as a navy cook, turning rations into meals that kept morale steady on long deployments. [PAWN_pronoun] loved food in all its forms, and made sure every trooper got a taste of home before marching out again.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_TrooperMedic
BackstoryDef.title: medical specialist
BackstoryDef.description: The empire needed fighters, but it also needed someone to keep them breathing. [PAWN_nameDef] trained as a navy medic, patching wounds in field stations and shuttle bays. In battle, [PAWN_pronoun] learned that speed mattered more than precision—lives didn’t wait for perfection.

As a navy medic, [PAWN_nameDef] often worked in the shadows of the fight. While troopers fired their rifles, [PAWN_pronoun] crawled through smoke and debris to reach the wounded. It wasn’t glorious, but it kept the imperial navy alive and kicking.

The empire’s battles never paused for the wounded. [PAWN_nameDef] carried a medkit through gunfire, working under pressure that would break most soldiers. [PAWN_pronoun] wasn’t there to fight—[PAWN_pronoun] was there to make sure others could keep fighting.

Every squad needed a medic, and [PAWN_nameDef] filled that role with grim efficiency. From sealing plasma burns to stopping blood loss, [PAWN_pronoun] made the difference between survival and a body bag. Troopers trusted [PAWN_possessive] hands more than armor.

[PAWN_nameDef] had seen enough battlefields to stomach blood, but fire was different. The searing stench of burned flesh clung to every memory of plasma strikes and shipboard blazes. From then on, [PAWN_pronoun] treated wounds without hesitation—but [PAWN_pronoun] could never bring [PAWN_objective]self to face the flames.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_ShockTrooper
BackstoryDef.title: shock trooper
BackstoryDef.description: Imperial shock troopers lived for the breach. [PAWN_nameDef] carried pulse blaster and TD grenades into gravship corridors where seconds meant survival. Training drilled out fear, leaving only precision—and [PAWN_pronoun] delivered it with every strike.

[PAWN_nameDef] treated shock trooper duty like a game of chance—kick in the hatch, toss the grenades, and see who was left standing. Reckless as it seemed, [PAWN_pronoun] had a knack for walking out of firefights others feared to enter.

Imperial shock troopers were the empire’s spearpoint, and [PAWN_nameDef] was no exception. Pulse blaster steady, grenades primed, [PAWN_pronoun] carved a path through gravship hulls with methodical precision. Chaos reigned outside the breach, but inside, every move was calculated.

Every breach hardened [PAWN_nameDef] further. Smoke, blood, and shattered bulkheads became the rhythm of [PAWN_possessive] service as a shock trooper. Resistance never lasted long; once the charge went off, [PAWN_pronoun] was already moving through the wreckage.

For [PAWN_nameDef], shock trooper duty was an exact science: breach, clear, secure. Training honed [PAWN_objective] into a weapon sharper than steel, and when orders came down, [PAWN_pronoun] struck with flawless execution.

Imperial shock troopers were the empire’s hammer, and [PAWN_nameDef] swung hard. Breaches ended in fire and broken resistance, corridors cleared with ruthless speed. To enemies, [PAWN_pronoun] wasn’t a soldier—[PAWN_pronoun] was the executioner at the door.

To [PAWN_nameDef], breaching was the purest test of courage. The deafening explosion, the rush of smoke, the charge into fire—moments where hesitation vanished and pride carried [PAWN_objective] forward as the empire’s vanguard.

Storming through gravship hulls wasn’t just a duty for [PAWN_nameDef]—it was an art. Each charge was placed with care, each blast a signature. Fellow shock troopers fought to survive; [PAWN_pronoun] fought to make the breach unforgettable.

[PAWN_nameDef] moved through breaches like a machine, pulse blaster steady and grenades placed with cold precision. No shouts, no fury—just the methodical clearing of targets until nothing remained. Fellow shock troopers called [PAWN_objective] heartless, but none denied [PAWN_pronoun] was reliable.

Every breach felt like a thrill ride to [PAWN_nameDef]. The explosions, the chaos, the rush of storming into enemy fire—[PAWN_pronoun] embraced it all. Recklessness kept commanders wary, but victories piled up behind [PAWN_possessive] name.
As an imperial shock trooper, [PAWN_nameDef] shrugged off wounds that would fell lesser soldiers. Bandages could wait—[PAWN_pronoun] had breaches to clear, and pain was just another obstacle.

Most shock troopers cursed the cramped gravship corridors, but [PAWN_nameDef] thrived in them. Tight corners, no room to retreat—exactly how [PAWN_pronoun] liked it. For [PAWN_objective], there was no better feeling than standing toe-to-toe with the enemy and refusing to give ground.

BackstoryDef.title: unstoppable shock trooper
BackstoryDef.description: Beneath the armor, [PAWN_nameDef] was fury given form. Shock trooper duty gave [PAWN_objective] the chance to unleash it—breaching gravship hulls, cutting down raiders, and crushing resistance under boot. The empire called it duty. Enemies called it terror.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_RailgunTrooper
BackstoryDef.title: railgun trooper
BackstoryDef.description: As an imperial railgun trooper, [PAWN_nameDef] carried a weapon that could punch through nearly anything. The recoil was brutal, but once [PAWN_pronoun] mastered it, few enemies could stand against [PAWN_possessive] fire.

As an imperial railgun trooper, [PAWN_nameDef] fired with icy precision. Each pull of the trigger sent a burst strong enough to tear through cover, and each burst landed exactly where [PAWN_pronoun] intended. To [PAWN_objective], it wasn’t battle—it was target practice.

The pulse railgun kicked like a beast, but [PAWN_nameDef] tamed it with calm discipline. Burst after burst slammed through enemy lines, leaving no room for mistakes. [PAWN_pronoun] never raised [PAWN_possessive] voice, never lost [PAWN_possessive] focus—just aimed, fired, and moved on.

As an imperial railgun trooper, [PAWN_nameDef] kept to the shadows of the squad. Aloof and quiet, [PAWN_pronoun] spoke little, but the pulse railgun did all the talking [PAWN_objective] needed. Every burst tore through the enemy, even if [PAWN_pronoun] avoided eye contact with allies.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_NORDAgent
BackstoryDef.title: NORD agent
BackstoryDef.description: As a Naval Order and Regulation Division field agent, [PAWN_nameDef] worked in the shadows where soldiers could not. Infiltrations, assassinations, and sudden disappearances followed in [PAWN_possessive] wake, leaving enemies broken and silent.

The empire demanded order, and the Naval Order and Regulation Division provided it by any means. [PAWN_nameDef] drugged prisoners, broke traitors in interrogation cells, and silenced witnesses who might weaken the fleet’s resolve.

As a field agent of the Naval Order and Regulation Division, [PAWN_nameDef] was dispatched where whispers of conspiracy lingered. [PAWN_pronoun] blended in, gathered secrets, and cut out threats before they could fester. Few ever saw [PAWN_objective] coming.

As a Naval Order and Regulation Division field agent, [PAWN_nameDef] carried out missions that could never be spoken of. [PAWN_pronoun] slipped behind enemy lines, dismantled cells of traitors, and made sure the empire’s problems never lived long enough to spread.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_NORDOfficer
BackstoryDef.title: NORD officer
BackstoryDef.description: The Naval Order and Regulation Division gave [PAWN_nameDef] authority to question and correct the empire’s officers. Some feared [PAWN_objective], but most knew [PAWN_pronoun] sought only to keep units sharp. Discipline, guidance, and the occasional hard truth were [PAWN_possessive] tools, wielded for the empire’s good.

As a Naval Order and Regulation Division officer, [PAWN_nameDef] oversaw inspections of barracks, supplies, and command posts. Fraud and negligence were punished swiftly, but [PAWN_pronoun] also made sure soldiers had the support they needed to fight effectively.

In the Naval Order and Regulation Division, [PAWN_nameDef] acted as both auditor and advisor. Reports were scrutinized, chains of command tested, and gaps in discipline closed. When morale faltered, [PAWN_pronoun] provided counsel—because a soldier who wavered today might not stand tomorrow.

As a Naval Order and Regulation Division officer, [PAWN_nameDef] worked quietly among the ranks, listening more than speaking. A misplaced word could reveal corruption, a tired expression could reveal strain. [PAWN_pronoun] offered a steady hand, ensuring the empire’s soldiers remained both loyal and unbroken.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_LineLt
BackstoryDef.title: squad commander
BackstoryDef.description: Every officer started somewhere. For [PAWN_nameDef], that meant fumbling over maps, second-guessing [PAWN_possessive] own orders, and letting sergeants quietly cover [PAWN_possessive] mistakes. Even so, [PAWN_pronoun] showed flashes of potential—enough that the empire kept [PAWN_objective] in command.

As a lieutenant, [PAWN_nameDef] led a squad of troopers through their first deployments. Orders were often rough around the edges, sometimes misjudged, but [PAWN_pronoun] learned quickly—because mistakes on the field were paid for in blood.

[PAWN_nameDef] knew how to salute, issue commands, and wear the uniform right—but managing troopers in the field was another matter. A missed signal here, a botched formation there, and yet somehow [PAWN_pronoun] always pulled through by sheer stubbornness.

As a lieutenant, [PAWN_nameDef] carried authority well but often misread the field. A wrong turn, a mistimed order—small mistakes that veterans grumbled about. Still, [PAWN_pronoun] never shied from responsibility, learning leadership one error at a time.

BackstoryDef.title: company commander
BackstoryDef.description: Every officer started somewhere.
